awd_abstract_narration:
The 39th Southeastern Analysis Meeting (SEAM 39) will be held on campus at Clemson University in Clemson, South Carolina from Thursday, March 9, 2023, until Saturday, March 11, 2023.  In its long history, SEAM has become a leading venue for mathematical analysis and its applications. SEAM is held annually at a university in the Southeastern US and attracts participants and speakers from throughout the United States and abroad. SEAM encourages the participation and professional development of early-career members of the analysis research community and members of groups underrepresented in mathematics. Its mission includes facilitating the development of scientific collaborations and professional relationships between researchers at all career stages. The meeting website is hosted at http://www.math.clemson.edu/seam.

SEAM is a major conference in analysis emphasizing current trends and significant developments in operator theory, complex analysis, harmonic analysis, and related fields, including operator algebras, control theory, and partial differential equations.  The meeting provides a forum for experienced researchers, early-career faculty, postdocs, and graduate students to discuss recent advances in the field, present their work, and develop new collaborations. The scientific program consists of plenary talks given by leading mathematicians at various career stages, and contributed talks open to all participants. As an annual event with a dedicated focus, SEAM is now a part of the mathematical research community infrastructure, enhancing research in mathematics and graduate education.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The focus of this project was to hold the 39th Southeastern Analysis Meeting (SEAM 39), a conference in mathematical analysis that is hosted annually at a university in the Southeastern United States. SEAM 39 was held at Clemson University in Clemson, South Carolina from March 9, 2023 until March 11, 2023.

SEAM 39 had 9 plenary lectures given by the following invited speakers: Galia Dafni (Concordia University), Stephan Garcia (Pomona College), Walton Green (Washington University in St. Louis), Michael Jury (University of Florida), Eugenia Malinnikova (Stanford University), Elodie Pozzi (Saint Louis University), Joel Rosenfeld (University of South Florida), Gennady Uraltsev (University of Virginia), and Manasa Vempati (Georgia Institute of Technology). Of these speakers, 4 were women and 5 were junior mathematicians. Additionally, there were 25 contributed talks delivered mostly by graduate students, postdocs, and junior faculty members.

Topics focused on recent advances in the mathematics at the intersection of operator theory, classical complex analysis, and harmonic analysis, as well as related fields including operator algebras, control theory, and partial differential equations. The meeting format facilitated the development of new scientific collaborations and professional relationships among researchers across all career stages. 

SEAM 39 continued the tradition of serving as the first major research conference for many beginning researchers -- 22 of the 50 participants were students and 9 were postdocs. 

Funds from this award were primarily put towards participant support. Priority was given to members of groups underrepresented in mathematics, graduate students, postdocs, junior faculty, and finally to more established researchers without external support. 


Last Modified: 03/07/2024
Modified by: Cody B Stockdale
